{0} of Backup Storage included with your Dedicated Storage
Get a free cloud-based storage space separate to your server, and dedicated to your backups. The solution is scalable, and can be reached via several access protocols (Rsync, SCP, sFTP).

To enable your Backup Storage option, firstly you need to link it to a new cloud project by entering its name, or selecting an existing cloud project. The Backup Storage option is free, and works instantly. You will receive your login details via email.
I have read and accepted the terms and conditions described in the following documents:
You have successfully created your storage space.
The project linked to your Backup Storage option has been suspended.
The Backup Storage option is being disabled.

Your server's Backup Storage option has now been disabled. Your PCS container is still active. If you do not delete it, you will be billed at the end of the month for the amount corresponding to what has been used.
Need a tool to back up your data? OVH recommends Rclone
Manage users for access to OpenStack
You have not subscribed to the Cisco ASA firewall.
You cannot subscribe because you NIC handle is not authorised to place orders for this server.
You cannot choose this service as this option is not available with this server.

Order of the following option on the server {0}
For the first payment, you will be invoiced pro rata for the number of days remaining before your server renewal date.
The billing for this option will be synchronised with your service's renewal date.
The purchase order has been generated.
To confirm your order, please click the "Pay" button below.
A new tab will open, and you will be automatically redirected to the OVH payment interface.
Please note that a delay of approximately 2 hours is required from the time of your payment being accepted, for the activation of the option to be taken into account on your Dedicated Control Panel.

The IPMI module is not available on this server.
However, you benefit from this feature with a KVM.
The server status is {0}. The IPMI module is therefore disabled.
IPMI enables you to log in to your server via the following methods:

By starting a 'Remote KVM' session (access to the keyboard, mouse and display of your remote server) from your IP {0}
Via a Java Web Start applet

By starting a 'Serial Over LAN' session (access to the serial console of your machine via a secure connection) via your IP {0}
Via your web browser (https)

You can enter the post-installation script URL here. It enables easy finalisation of your system installation. You can easily configure your preferences and install software. Attention: the maximum script execution time is 1 hour.
It involves all or part of the expected result on standard exit following execution of the script. You can leave this field empty but it's not advisable.

Add a key under the My Account section

Select the distribution you want to install on the server: {0}
You can proceed directly to installation or you can customise it.
You need a licence to install a Windows OS (apart from for Windows HyperV). You can add licences in the Licences section in the customer account.
Warning: Unless you have selected the target disk array ({0}), you will not be able to customise the hardware RAID configuration.
The Hardware RAID configuration is only available for servers located on the same continent as your customer account.
This OS installer cannot reconfigure your RAID. If you want to reconfigure your hardware RAID, please install another OS. The configuration will then be saved.
The ({0}) chosen OS does not have virtual machine functionality, choose another licence if you need to. No other OS available? Go to the Licences section in the customer account.
Warning, you have started to configure an installation on distribution {0}. Modifying the distribution will delete this configuration.
In order to improve the visibility of partitions, you can change their colour by clicking on the bar above.
Choose the RAID hardware configuration on which your chosen OS will be installed.
No RAID controller. You cannot configure your RAID hardware.
There was an error loading your RAID setup. Please try again.
Disk cannot be allocated for this installation:

The RAID (starting from RAID 1) enables data to be replicated on multiple hard drives so as to improve the server's data backup in case of failure. Attention: RAID 0 does not save the data and is therefore not recommended.
This size is the space that can be taken up by your data.

This size varies depending on the RAID used. If a server has 2 hard disks, a RAID 1 duplicates the data of a partition on the 2 disks, thus doubling the space used. If 1 of the 2 disks fails, the data will not be lost.
Configuration of partition schemes for the {0} distribution
In a CacheCade configuration, the disk space dedicated to the cache cannot be partitioned.
No partition scheme is compatible with the server {0} for distribution {1}. Please choose another distribition.
You have reached the limit for available space. You must reduce the space taken up by this partition.
Warning: if you configure this partition in RAID 0, you will gain space; however, in the event of a hard drive failure, all data on this partition will be permanently lost.
The {0} partition must be in RAID 1
All LV partitions must have the same RAID.
A partition has already been assigned to this order number
The primary partition must have /boot or / as the mount point. If the 2 partitions are present, /boot must be placed in primary position.
The primary partition must have the following as mount point c:
The volume name is compulsory for an LV partition.
The volume name must not contain special symbols, it must not exceed 16 characters and it must be different from pvmove and snapshot.
This volume name is already in use.
This mount point cannot be used, the name is incorrect. Special characters are not allowed (except _ / and -) the maximum number of characters is 255.
The mount point /var/log is not authorised for this distribution. You must use /home/log.
Mount point c: must be primary type.
The mount point cannot be used. It must be between c and z and end with:
This mount point is already in use.
A partition that doesn't support GPT cannot exceed {0}.
The minimum size of a Windows partition is {0}.
The minimum size of a ReiserFS partition is {0}.
The minimum size of a /boot partition is {0}.
You don't have enough space available for a new partition. Modify or delete a partition to free up some space.
The minimum size of a partition is {0}
A primary partition must be preceded by a primary partition.
An LV partition must be followed by an LV partition.
You cannot have a logical partition logique and an LV partition at the same time.
You cannot have more than 4 primary partitions. Change 1 primary partition to another type in order to add other partitions.
Swap partitions are not compatible with LV partitions.
